description: {"blocks":[{"key":"caae7","text":"The catalase enzyme is found in most aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria that contain cytochrome, being the main exception Streptococcus. Organisms that do not have the cytochrome system also lack the enzyme catalase and therefore cannot break down hydrogen peroxide.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s32l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dp9bp","text":"Transfer 2-4 colonies of the bacterial growth in blood agar plates to a glass","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"142c4","text":"slide using a sterile plastic loop, make circles, and let it dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aif1b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"15adt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9u4a0","text":"NOTE: Culture should be 18 to 24 hours old. Metal loops could cause false","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5jeuj","text":"positives.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"copok","text":"Place a drop of hydrogen peroxide (H 2 0 2 ) on the glass slide with an","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3upqn","text":"eyedropper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tug7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"h67u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7nk1f","text":"NOTE: Store the hydrogen peroxide in a dark bottle and avoid exposure to","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1thfj","text":"light. Keep refrigerated when not in use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fm0t7","text":"Observe immediate results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n332","text":"Positive: The oxygen released will be observed as a formation of bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co1bn","text":"Negative: No or very few bubbles produced.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rohq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c8pja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6c9c1","text":"NOTE: Group B Streptococcus agalactiae is catalase-negative.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Catalase test for bacterial identification
